description: Uses ImageMagick to add read-only views of over 100 image formats in Visual Studio Code.
configuration.title: Magick Image Reader
configuration.imageBackground.descriptio: The style to render behind the image.
configuration.imageBackground.checkered: A checkered background, similar to that of most image editors.
configuration.imageBackground.transapare: No background whatsoever, similar to the default Visual Studio Code behavior.
configuration.imageBackground.custom: Define custom CSS in the "Magick Image Reader: Background Custom CSS" property.
configuration.backgroundCustomCss: If `#magickImageReader.imageBackground#` is set to `custom`, uses the styles (CSS) configured here.
configuration.backgroundCustomCss.backgr: This can use hex color codes, and color names to set a static background color.
This can specify a base64 encoded image, or CSS functions like linear-gradient.
If using background-image, set if it should repeat.
Set if the background is fixed or should scroll along with the content.
Set where the background should be placed behind the image
Configure how colors overlap, this is useful with more complex styles.
Set the size of the background.
views.explorer.layerViewer.name: Layers
